page.title: 06A38 trunk road
page.content: The A38 is used extensively for commuting to Bristol,and also for traffic to and from Bristol airport whose southern edge is just north of Redhill. The road leads southwards to Devon and so carries quite a lot of holiday traffic in the summer.However most of it now uses the M5 motorway a few miles to the west. As a result of the traffic there are on the A38 a farm shop,a post office,a pub,a farm with bed and breakfast accomodation,an agricultural engineers' and premises for selling cars and motor caravans. The bus service from Bristol to Weston-super-mare goes down the A38 to Redhill,before turning off towards Wrington at Redhill.
